question_text: The Open Source Definition maintained by the Open Source Initiative was originally based on which set of guidelines?
correct_answer: The Debian Free Software Guidelines, written primarily by Bruce Perens
distractors: The GNU General Public License terms drafted by Richard Stallman
The Apache Software Foundation's licensing principles
The MIT License framework developed at Massachusetts Institute of Technology

question_text: What was the name of the first web browser, and who created it in 1990?
correct_answer: WorldWideWeb, created by Tim Berners-Lee at CERN
distractors: Mosaic, created by Marc Andreessen at the University of Illinois
Nexus, created by Robert Cailliau at MIT
Navigator, created by James Gosling at Sun Microsystems

question_text: In 1947, a team working on the Harvard Mark II computer taped an insect into their logbook, an incident that helped popularize the computing term 'bug.' What type of insect was it?
correct_answer: A moth found stuck between relay contacts
distractors: A beetle found lodged inside a vacuum tube
A fly caught in the paper tape reader mechanism
An ant discovered shorting a circuit on the main board

question_text: Who proposed the relational model for databases in 1970 while working at IBM, publishing the influential paper 'A Relational Model of Data for Large Shared Data Banks'?
distractors: Donald Chamberlin, co-inventor of SQL
Charles Bachman, creator of the network data model
Michael Stonebraker, developer of Ingres and PostgreSQL

question_text: SQL was originally developed at IBM under a different name that had to be changed due to a trademark conflict. What was that original name?
distractors: SQUARE (Specifying Queries Using A Relational Engine)
QUEL (Query Language for relational databases)
ISAM (Indexed Sequential Access Method)

question_text: The TCP/IP model organizes Internet communication protocols into four abstraction layers. From lowest to highest, what are these layers?
correct_answer: Link layer, Internet layer, Transport layer, Application layer
distractors: Physical layer, Data link layer, Network layer, Session layer
Hardware layer, Routing layer, Connection layer, Service layer
Access layer, Network layer, Host layer, Process layer

question_text: Linus Torvalds created Git in 2005 for Linux kernel development after losing access to which proprietary version control system?
correct_answer: BitKeeper, whose free license was revoked for Linux developers
distractors: Subversion (SVN), which could not handle the kernel's repository size
Perforce, which ended its open-source partnership with the kernel team
ClearCase, whose IBM licensing fees became too expensive for the project

question_text: Which programming language, developed in Norway during 1961-1967, is generally accepted as the first language to introduce classes, inheritance, and dynamic binding?
correct_answer: Simula, developed by Ole-Johan Dahl and Kristen Nygaard
distractors: Smalltalk, developed by Alan Kay and Dan Ingalls at Xerox PARC
LISP, developed by John McCarthy at MIT
C++, developed by Bjarne Stroustrup at Bell Labs

question_text: In operating systems, what is the key distinction between a program and a process?
correct_answer: A program is a passive set of instructions on disk; a process is an active instance being executed in memory
distractors: A program runs in kernel mode while a process runs in user mode only
A program can use multiple CPUs while a process is limited to a single core
A program is compiled code while a process is interpreted code running in a virtual machine

question_text: In virtual memory systems, what hardware component in the CPU automatically translates virtual addresses to physical addresses?
distractors: The arithmetic logic unit (ALU)
The translation lookaside buffer (TLB) controller
The direct memory access (DMA) controller
